Pre-Game Insights: Bafana Bafana will test themselves against former African champions, Algeria in a FIFA Series match on Tuesday night. South Africa is still in high spirits after finishing third at the recent CAF African Cup of Nations tournament in Ivory Coast.
Under the management of Hugo Broos, Bafana will bank on their fine run and will look to cause an upset against the highly-rated Algerian side.

The Desert Foxes boasts top football stars such as Aissa Mandi, Nabil Bentaleb, Yacine Brahimi, and Said Benrahma among others. However, the hosts will be without Ismael Bennacer due to injury, while Ramy Bensebaini is doubtful for the clash while Riyad Mahrez was left out of the squad at his request.
Coach Broos is wary of the Algerians but they are a beatable opponent.

The Mamelodi Sundowns skipper and Bafana creative midfielder will be one of the players to watch in the tie. Zwane will be key for Bafana to ensure they rotate the ball and cause all sorts of problems for the hosts.

The industrious Al Gharafa midfielder will be tasked with opening up the defence of Bafana. With his silky touches and brilliant movement off the ball, Brahimi is one of the players to watch for the Foxes.
The former AFCON winner with Cameroon boasts extensive knowledge of African football and will look to guide Bafana to a win.
The newly appointed coach will want to start his tenure on a high and bag a win over the South Africans.
With Bafana fresh from their impressive run at AFCON, there is no doubt that the fans will expect a win over their hosts.
While many still doubt Bafana under Broos who is controversial in his team selections, some South Africans believe he has restored the nationâ€™s hopes.
This is one of the toughest games to predict but one can give Bafana a chance to secure a victory. Bafana is growing in stature and with confidence, they can claim a win on Tuesday.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bafana will be a different side on Tuesday when the likes of Themba Zwane, Ronwen Williams, and Siyanda Xulu are all set to return to the starting eleven.
The Desert Foxes will be without Ismael Bennacer due to injury, while Ramy Bensebaini is doubtful for the clash while Riyad Mahrez was left out of the squad at his request.

Their most recent meeting was in the group stage of the 2015 Africa Cup of Nations, with Algeria claiming a 3-1 win in Mongomo, Equatorial Guinea, thanks to an own goal from Thulani Hlatshwayo and strikes by Faouzi Ghoulam and Islam Slimani.
Others: Bafana Bafana will play against Algeria on March 26, 2024, at 11:00 PM SAST at Nelson Mandela Stadium in Algiers.
The game will be a FIFA Series match.
